definitions.definition: a substance, especially when you do not know or say exactly what it is:
examples: There's sticky stuff all over the chair.

definitions.definition: things that someone says or does, when you are referring to them in a general way without saying exactly what they are:
examples: All that stuff she has been saying about Lee is just not true.

definitions.definition: someone's possessions or things that they take somewhere with them:
examples: We'll have to carry all our camping stuff.

definitions.definition: used to refer to more things of a similar kind to ones you have mentioned, when you do not say exactly what they are:
examples: This is the drawer where I keep paper and envelopes and stuff.

definitions.definition: to completely fill a container with something:
examples: Stuff the pillow and then sew up the final seam.

definitions.definition: to push something into a small space, often quickly or in a careless way:
examples: This suitcase is absolutely full - I can't stuff another thing into it.

definitions.definition: to fill the body of a dead animal with special material so that it looks as if it is still alive
(of a man) to have sex with a woman
